required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Registry Study of Intracranial Atherosclerotic Stenosis Treatment by Intracranial Drug-eluting Stenting in China
clinical_study.official_title: To Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the NOVA Intracranial Drug-eluting Stent System in "Real World" Patients With Intracranial Atherosclerotic Stenosis: A Prospective, Multicenter, Post-marketing Registry Clinical Study (NOVA II)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this trial is to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of the NOVA intracranial drug-eluting stent system in "real world" patients with intracranial atherosclerotic stenosis.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigation is a prospective, multi-center, single arm clinical study. The trial is anticipated to last from December 2022 to December 2030 with 1000 subjects recruited in around 50 Chinese centers. The population for this study is subjects with intracranial atherosclerotic stenosis who are suitable candidates for stent angioplasty. Patients fulfilling all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria will be enrolled after they signed the informed consent form. The study consists of ten visits including preoperative screening, operation date, 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years. The primary outcome was a composite of stroke or death within 30 days or any ischemic stroke or revascularization from the original culprit intracranial artery beyond 30 days through 12 months after operation.

primary_outcome.measure: stroke or death within 30 days or any ischemic stroke or revascularization from the original culprit intracranial artery beyond 30 days through 12 months after operation.
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome was a composite of ischemic/hemorrhagic stroke and all-cause death within 30 days, or any ischemic stroke and revascularization from the original culprit intracranial artery beyond 30 days through 12 months after enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of any stroke (hemorrhagic/ischemic stroke) in the target blood supply area or all-cause death at 30 days after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of Hemorrhagic stroke as well as symptomatic ischemic stroke and any death in the target blood supply area

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of any stroke (hemorrhagic/ischemic stroke) in the non-target blood supply area or all-cause death at 30 days after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of Hemorrhagic stroke as well as symptomatic ischemic stroke and any death in the non-target blood supply area

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of transient ischemic attack at 30 days, 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Transient ischemic attack (TIA) is a temporary blockage of blood flow to the brain with symptoms last from only a few minutes up to 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of any stroke (hemorrhagic/ischemic stroke) in the target blood supply area at 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of Hemorrhagic stroke as well as symptomatic ischemic stroke in the target blood supply area

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of any stroke (hemorrhagic/ischemic stroke) in the non-target blood supply area at 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of Hemorrhagic stroke as well as symptomatic ischemic stroke in the non-target blood supply area

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of death (vascular/ non-vascular death) at 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The cause of death was classified as vascular or nonvascular and based on information obtained from the family, medical records, and death certificates. Vascular death included death due to stroke, myocardial infarction (MI), heart failure, pulmonary embolus, cardiac arrhythmia, or other vascular cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of symptomatic in-stent restenosis (ISR) and Revascularization at 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: symptomatic ISR is defined as ISR associated with an ischemic event in the territory. Revascularization is the restoration or improvement of blood supply, and included surgical operation, endovascular procedures, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of modified Rankin Scale (mRS) at 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a commonly used scale for measuring the degree of disability or dependence in the daily activities of people who have suffered a stroke or other causes of neurological disability. The scale runs from 0-6 with "0" being perfect health without symptoms to "6" being death.

secondary_outcome.measure: EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) score at 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3, 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: A health state defined by the descriptive EQ-5D system can be described by a five-digit number, each digit indicating the score of the corresponding dimension. For the description component a subject self-rates their health in terms of five dimensions; mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression using either a three-level or a five-level scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of in-stent restenosis at 1, 2, 3, 4 years and 5 years after operation (Optional)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with ≥50% stenosis of the vessel

Device defects refer to the unreasonable risks that may endanger human health and life safety during the normal use of medical devices in the course of clinical trials, such as label errors, quality problems, failures, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of bleeding events at 1 years after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding was defined according to Bleeding Academic Research Consortium

arm_group.description: All patients will be implanted with Drug-Eluting Stents (NOVA DES).

intervention.description: The NOVA stent is a sirolimus-eluting stent system designed for intracranial artery stenosis with a rapid exchangeable balloon
